subtitle: Have you ever tried beef cooked in cider before? Well this delicious West Country style casserole is definitely one to try.

method.text: Heat half the oil in a large saucepan. Add the onion, celery and apple and fry for 2-3 min or until softened. Remove from pan with a slotted spoon and set aside.
Heat the remaining oil then add the beef and sausages. Fry for 5 min or until well browned and sealed.
Add the flour to the pan and cook for 1 min. Gradually add the stock and cider, stirring constantly, until all is incorporated.
Return the vegetables to the pan with the bay leaves and seasoning. Bring to the boil then transfer to an ovenproof casserole dish.
Cover and cook in the oven at 180°C for 1hr 30 min, stirring occasionally, until meat is tender.
Adjust seasoning. Serve in a warmed serving dish.

title: Somerset style beef with cider
